SEARCH
Package com.icx.domain

Class DomainController<T extends DomainObject>

java.lang.Object
com.icx.common.Common
com.icx.domain.DomainController<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Base type of domain objects
Direct Known Subclasses:
SqlDomainController
public abstract class DomainController<T extends DomainObject> extends Common
Manages domain object store.

Register domain classes. Create and register domain objects. Manages accumulations (of child objects).

Specific domain controllers extend this class.

  • Nested Class Summary

    • registerDomainClasses

      public void registerDomainClasses(Class<T> baseClass, String domainPackageName) throws DomainException
      Register domain classes by given domain package.

      All classes in this package and in any sub package which extends DomainObject class will be registered as domain classes.

      Top level domain classes are so called 'object domain classes'. E.g.: RaceBike extends Bike (extends SqlDomainObject) -> RaceBike is 'object' domain class, Bike is domain class. Non-'object' domain classes must be abstract.

      Parameters:
      baseClass - class where all domain classes to register are derived from (SqlDomainObject.class)
      domainPackageName - name of package where domain classes reside
      Throws:
      DomainException - on registration error

    • registerDomainClasses

      @SafeVarargs public final void registerDomainClasses(Class<T> baseClass, Class<? extends T>... domainClasses) throws DomainException
      Register given object domain classes and derived domain classes.

      Classes must extend DomainObject class. Automatically registers base domain classes for given object domain class on inherited domain classes (RaceBike extends Bike -> only RaceBike has to be provided). Automatically registers inner domain classes and parent domain classes (Bike references Manufacturer -> only Bike has to be provided) too.

      Parameters:
      baseClass - class where all domain classes to register are derived from (SqlDomainObject.class)
      domainClasses - list of object domain classes to register
      Throws:
      DomainException - on registration error

    • getDomainClassByName

      Only for internal use!
      Parameters:
      className - name of domain class
      Returns:
      domain class object

    • generateUniqueId

      protected long generateUniqueId()
      Only for internal use but may be overridden: Generate unique object id.

      Id scheme: Date().getTime() * 1.000.000 + (atomic counter % 1000 starting randomly with 100, 200, ..., 900) * 1000 + random integer % 1000

      Returns:
      unique id

    • create

      public final <S extends T> S create(Class<S> domainObjectClass, Consumer<S> init)
      Create, initialize and register object of domain class.

      Calls initialization function before object registration to ensure that registered object is initialized.

      Uses default constructor which therefore must be defined explicitly if other constructors are defined!

      Type Parameters:
      S - specific object domain class type
      Parameters:
      domainObjectClass - instantiable domain (object) class
      init - object initialization function
      Returns:
      newly created domain object

    • register

      public <S extends T> S register(S obj)
      Register object in object store.

      To call if constructor is used to create domain object instead of using create(Class, java.util.function.Consumer) or SqlDomainController.createAndSave(Class, java.util.function.Consumer).

      Type Parameters:
      S - object domain class
      Parameters:
      obj - object to register in object store
      Returns:
      this object

    • isRegistered

      public boolean isRegistered(DomainObject obj)
      Check if object is registered.
      Parameters:
      obj - object to check
      Returns:
      true if object is registered, false if it was deleted or if it was not loaded because it was out of data horizon on load time

    • all

      public final <S extends T> Set<S> all(Class<S> domainClass)
      Retrieve all registered objects of a specific domain class.

      Returns new set containing objects instead of existing collection which is part of object store.

      Type Parameters:
      S - specific domain class type
      Parameters:
      domainClass - domain class - may be an object domain class or a - non instantiable - base class of an object domain class (RaceBike or Bike)
      Returns:
      newly created set of all registered objects of given domain class

      true if a registered object of given domain class exists, false otherwise

    • hasAny

      public final <S extends T> boolean hasAny(Class<S> domainClass, Predicate<S> predicate)

      Parameters:

      predicate - predicate to fulfill

      predicate - predicate to fulfill
      Returns:

    • sort

      public final <S extends T> List<S> sort(Collection<S> objectCollection)
      Build sorted list from collection of domain objects of a specific domain class.

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • groupBy

      public <S1, S2 extends T> SortedMap<S1,Set<S2>> groupBy(Set<S2> accumulation, Function<S2,S1> classifier)
      Group (accumulated) elements by given classifier.

      Example: Map<Manufacturer, List<Bike>> bikeByManufacturerMap = DomainController.groupBy(bikes, c -> c.manufacturer)

      Type Parameters:
      S1 - type of classifier objects
      S2 - domain class type of (child) objects to group
      Parameters:
      accumulation - set of (child) objects to group; typically an 'accumulation' - a managed set of children defined using Annotations.Accumulation annotation
      classifier - classifier for elements of accumulation - e.g.: a reference to another domain object, a property, a property of a referenced domain object
      Returns:
      map with (accumulated) objects grouped by classifier

    • countBy

      public <S1, S2 extends T> SortedMap<S1,Integer> countBy(Set<S2> accumulation, Function<S2,S1> classifier)
      Count (accumulated) elements by given classifier.

      Like groupBy(Set, Function).

      Type Parameters:
      S1 - type of classifier objects
      S2 - domain class type of (child) objects to group
      Parameters:
      accumulation - set of (child) objects to group; typically an 'accumulation' - a managed set of children defined using Annotations.Accumulation annotation
      classifier - classifier for elements of accumulation - e.g.: a reference to another domain object, a property, a property of a referenced domain object
      Returns:
      map with count of (accumulated) objects grouped by classifier
